title: Full-Stack Web Developer
responsibilities: Developed fully responsive websites using the MERN stack
Built custom admin panels for real-time content management
Implemented server-side rendering with Next.js for SEO optimization
Managed end-to-end project delivery and client communication
achievements: Resolved critical usability issues on outdated client sites
Built user-friendly admin panel for real-time content updates to pricing and schedules
Improved search engine rankings and organic traffic through SSR implementation
Reduced data entry errors with intuitive admin interface

title: UI/UX Designer
responsibilities: Collaborated with product owners and cross-functional teams
Conducted UX research including interviews and data analysis
Designed high-fidelity UI prototypes from wireframes and sitemaps
Optimized information architecture for desktop and mobile platforms
achievements: Achieved 30% reduction in user navigation time through IA optimization
Enhanced overall site usability across desktop and mobile platforms
Conducted over 5 UX research sessions with insightful reports
Designed and conducted A/B tests on 20+ high-fidelity UI prototypes
Ensured alignment with business objectives through data-driven design

career_transition.reason: Why I Transitioned from Design to Development
career_transition.details: After spending two years as a UI/UX Designer at Lollypop Design Studio, I often saw the user experience get lost in translation when designs were handed off to developers. I realized that optimizing information architecture on a canvas was not enough - to truly control the end-to-end experience, I needed to build it myself. This realization drove me to pursue full-stack development while retaining my design thinking foundation.
